title.narrative: Humanitarian mine action in Afghanistan NL MFA 2020-2024

description.narrative: The target groups for this project are communities suffering from the threat of landmines and other explosive remnants of war in Afghanistan. The target group for capacity building is a local implementing partner.

This project aims to safe lives and increase livelihoods in Afghanistan by: 1) clearing landmines and other explosive items, 2) responding to EOD callouts, 3) providing victim assistance, 4) providing risk education and 5) providing capacity building to a local partner.

This project aims to safe lives and increase livelihoods in Afghanistan by: 1) clearing landmines and other explosive items, 2) responding to EOD callouts, 3) providing victim assistance, 4) providing risk education and 5) providing capacity building to a local partner.

title.narrative: Abandoned Explosive Ordnance equal/greater than 20mm (#)

description.narrative: Abandoned Explosive Ordnance equal/greater than 20mm (#)

title.narrative: Area Cancelled following NTS (m2)
Area Cancelled following NTS (m2)

description.narrative: Area Cancelled following NTS (m2)

comment.narrative: Cancellation targets are based on historical averages of land cancelled by the CORE team in a month. However, the areas surveyed by the CORE team are selected on an ad hoc basis, and it is not possible to predict in advance how much of the land can be cancelled. As such, achievements are unpredictable.
Cancellations targets are based on historical averages of land cancelled by the CORE team in a month. The areas surveyed are selected randomly, thus cancellation achievements cannot be predicted.

HALO has overachieved the cancellation target set for 2021 by over 40%. As mentioned in previous submission, cancellation targets are set as per historical averages and areas and so therefore, fluctuations in achievement are to be expected.
In line with the increased clearance productivity experienced in the final quarter of 2021, HALO teams were also able to cancel a far greater amount of land due to increased team deployments.

There was no cancellation this quarter. Targets are calculated using historical averages for the area a CORE team resurveys or cancels in a normal month, extrapolated across the entire project period. It is not possible to be more specific as these are often conducted by the CORE team as additional activities when attending community call-outs

There was no cancellation this quarter. Targets are calculated using historical averages for the area a CORE team resurveys or cancels in a normal month, extrapolated across the entire project period. It is not possible to be more specific as these are often conducted by the CORE team as additional activities when attending community call-outs

title.narrative: Area Resurveyed by NTS (m2)
Area Resurveyed by NTS (m2)

description.narrative: Area Resurveyed by NTS (m2)

comment.narrative: Area resurveyed targets are based on historical averages of land resurveyed by the CORE team in a month. However, the areas surveyed by the CORE team are selected on an ad hoc basis, whilst attending community call-outs, and cannot be planned in advance. As such, achievements are unpredictable. They also resurvey all the tasks on the workplan for the project, so once these are complete resurvey area achievements may level off slightly.

Large swathes of new contamination or unrecorded contamination was surveyed during this quarter. This is partially due to better access, as well as the scale of IED contaminaton being found in the southern provinces of Kandahar and Helmand.

The CORE team have over-achieved the target for this year. Area resurveyed targets are based on historical averages of land resurveyed by the CORE team in a month. However, the areas surveyed by the CORE team are selected on an ad hoc basis, whilst attending community call-outs, and cannot be planned in advance. As such, achievements are unpredictable. They also resurvey all the tasks on the workplan for the project, so once these are complete resurvey area achievements may level off slightly.

The teams have over-achieved the target for this year in the first quarter. The areas surveyed by the CORE team are selected on an ad hoc basis, whilst attending community call-outs, and cannot be planned in advance. As such, achievements are unpredictable.

The teams have over-achieved the target for this year in the first quarter. The areas surveyed by the CORE team are selected on an ad hoc basis, whilst attending community call-outs, and cannot be planned in advance. As such, achievements are unpredictable.
This quarter HALO has revised the re-survey target for the full contract period from 6,600,000 sqm to 20,600,000 sqm, given that we achieved 400% of the original 2021 target in the last quarter.

title.narrative: EOD Call-outs (#)
EOD Call-outs (#)

description.narrative: EOD Call-outs (#)

comment.narrative: EOD call-outs take place based on community demand, as such numbers of EOD call-outs cannot easily be projected. Targets were set according to historical trends.

The teams are on track to over-achieve the EOD call-out target for this year. This activity is subject to demand and as such it is not possible to predict accurately how many call-outs will take place.
The teams are still on track to over-achieve the EOD call-out target for this year.
The teams have over-achieved the EOD call-out target for this year in this quarter.

title.narrative: EORE Sessions (#)
EORE Sessions (#)

description.narrative: EORE Sessions (#)

comment.narrative: As explained in the last quarter, EORE sessions were increased over this quarter to compensate for lower achievement last quarter.

The sensitive security environments and the temporary suspension of EORE teams deployment reduced the number of EORE sessions in this quarter. As the fighting has now stopped nationwide and access is being negotiated, it can be expected that this number will increase in the next quarter.
The unstable security environments limited the access of teams in this quarter and led to a slight reduction in delivery of EORE sessions.

title.narrative: Female EORE Recipients (#)
Female EORE Recipients (#)

description.narrative: Female EORE Recipients (#)

comment.narrative: Despite security issues, a female EORE assessor could be deployed in this quarter, which allowed HALO to reach female EORE recipients despite a limited access.
Despite security issues, a female EORE assessor could be deployed in this quarter, which allowed HALO to reach female EORE recipients despite a limited access.
EORE beneficiaries are higher in line with the increase in EORE sessions delivered.

In this quarter, CORE teams were located in the north which is more insecure. As such, mixed-gender teams could not be deployed, so most EORE was delivered in madrasas which are dominated by boys with very few girls. Teams will focus on women and girls in Q2.

In this qurater, the CORE teams were still located in the north which was too insecure to deploy a female EORE assessor. As such, most EORE was delivered in mosques and commuinty centres which were dominated by men, boys with very few girls. However, as of April 2021, the CORE team has deployed a female EORE assessor, and the team expect to achieve the female and girl EORE beneficairies targets.

description.narrative: Female child EORE Recipients (#)

comment.narrative: A female EORE assessor could be deployed in this quarter, which permitted HALO to reach female child EORE recipients and significantly increased HALO's outputs compared to the previous quarters. The number of girls reached is still inferior to the number of boys reached, as only one of the two survey teams deployed is mixed-gender and can have access to girls.

A female EORE assessor could be deployed in this quarter, which permitted HALO to reach female child EORE recipients and significantly increased HALO's outputs compared to the previous quarters. The number of girls reached is still inferior to the number of boys reached, as only one of the two survey teams deployed is mixed-gender and can have access to girls.
EORE beneficiaries are higher in line with the increase in EORE sessions delivered.
HALO has revised the male child EORE beneficiary target given the 243% achievement of the contract target at the end of 2021.

In this quarter, CORE teams were located in the north which is more insecure. As such, mixed-gender teams could not be deployed, so most EORE was delivered in madrasas which are dominated by boys with very few girls. Teams will focus on women and girls in Q2.

In this quarter, the CORE teams were still located in the north which was too insecure to deploy a female EORE assessor. As such, most EORE was delivered in mosques and commuinty centres which were dominated by men, boys with very few girls. However, as of April 2021, the CORE team has deployed a female EORE assessor, and the team expect to achieve the female and girl EORE beneficairies targets.

title.narrative: Indirect Female Beneficiaries (#)
Indirect Female Beneficiaries (#)

description.narrative: Indirect Female Beneficiaries (#)

comment.narrative: The workplan for this project has numerous cases where there are multiple tasks in the same village. The indirect beneficiaries for these tasks will only be counted once, rather than being recounted for each individual task in their community. As such, we can expect to see an early over-achievement which will level out later when further tasks occur in the same location.

title.narrative: Land Cleared - Agricultural (m2)
Land Cleared - Agricultural (m2)

description.narrative: Land Cleared - Agricultural (m2)

comment.narrative: In the last quarter of 2021 HALO was able to deploy additional teams to support clearance on this project, this was partially to ensure recoverly of lost productivity throughout the summer months due to the instabiltiy in Afghanistan. Most of the land cleared was released for agricultural and residential use.

In this quarter, the number of teams deployed was lower in comparison to the previous quarter because of security and access limitations. The surface cleared in this quarter does not exceed the surface cleared in the previous quarter due to significant security and access issues in the context of the collapse of the former government, which significantly hampered our ability to deploy to several tasks for two weeks in August.

In this quarter, the surface of land cleared significantly increased from the previous quarter, due to the deployment of additional teams compared to the previous quarter. Most land worked in this quarter will be released to communities for agricultural purposes.
Most land worked on this quarter will be released to beneficiaries for agricultural and residential (housing) purposes.

title.narrative: Land returned to the community (m2)
Land returned to the community (m2)

description.narrative: Land returned to the community (m2)

comment.narrative: Teams continued to focus efforts on high priority clearance in the southern regions particularly Kandahar and Helmand.
Teams worked on a very large BAC task in Hairatan in Balkh. BAC clearance is generally faster than mine clearance or AIM clearance, and so high land clearance achievements were reached rapidly.
The AIM teams worked in Nangarhar province while the mechanical demining units and manual demining teams worked in Baghlan and Balkh provinces this quarter.

The HMA teams worked during this quarter in the provinces of Kabul, Balkh, Samangan and Parwan provinces. More specifically, AIM teams worked in the province of Nangarhar this quarter while mechanical demining units worked in Samangan and Balkh provinces.
The HMA teams worked on 6 tasks in Baklh and Baghlan provinces this quarter, and the AIM teams worked on 3 in Kunar and Nangarhar provinces.

comment.narrative: Almost all EORE recipients surveyed demonstrated an increase in knowledge this quarter, indicating that the previous shortcomings in knowledge increased have been successfully resolved.
Almost all EORE recipients surveyed demonstrated an increase in knowledge this quarter, indicating that the previous shortcomings in knowledge increased have been successfully resolved.
EORE beneficiaries are higher in line with the increase in EORE sessions delivered.

The number of EORE beneficiaries demonstrating improved knowledge is consistently higher than 90%. As HALO is overachieving on total number of EORE beneficairies reached, HALO is also overachieving on the number of beneficiaries surveyed.
The number of EORE beneficiaries demonstrating improved knowledge is slightly below where we expect it to be. This is be investigated at a training on the new surveys, taking place in February.
